content.text:
# List of New York State Historic Markers in Delaware County, New York

This is an incomplete list of New York State Historic Markers in Delaware County, New York. A fuller list is available from the Association of Public Historians of New York State.
Listings county-wide
{|class="wikitable sortable" style="width:98%"
! width = 2% |#
! width = 10% | Marker Name
! width = 8% class="unsortable" | Image
! width = 8% |Designator
! width = 10% |Location
! width = 8% |City or Town
! width = 6% |Coords
! class="unsortable" | Marker Text
|--
!  | 1
| DOWNSVILLE COVERED BRIDGE (north end)
|
|Downsville Women's Club (no date but must be 1998 or later)
|North side of Downsville Bridge
|Downsville
|
|DOWNSVILLE COVERED BRIDGE
BUILT IN 1854 BY ROBERT MURRAY  TO SPAN 174' OF THE EAST BRANCH  AT A COST OF $1700. RESTORED IN  1998 FOR $1,000,000 AS A TRIBUTE  TO THE SKILLS OF THE PAST
|--
!  | 2
| DOWNSVILLE COVERED BRIDGE (south end)
|
|Downsville Women's Club (no date but must be 1999 or later)
|South side of Downsville Bridge
|Downsville
|
|DOWNSVILLE COVERED BRIDGE
HAS BEEN PLACED ON THE NATIONAL  REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES  BY THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT  OF THE INTERIOR MAY 20, 1999
|--

BUILT 1796 LEADER OF  THE FOUNDERS OF WALTON.
|--

|State Ed Dept, 1949
|Intersection of Delaware St, Prospect St. and Highway 206
|Walton

HISTORIC ROUTE FROM KINGSTON TO JERICHO (BAINBRIDGE)

|Walton

1846-1887

| MIDDLETOWN SETTLEMENT
3 HUDSON VALLEY DUTCH  FAMILIES ARRIVED IN 1763 TO  SETTLE THE DELAWARE VALLEY  WHERE THE LENNI LENAPE  FIRST HUNTED AND FISHED
